title: IconButton
definition: Icon button is an icon that triggers an action when clicked or tapped. It is used to perform actions on small elements, where a regular button doesnâ€™t make sense. For example, it can be used to open a settings menu or to delete an item.

listItems.headline: Icon
listItems.text: See Icon for the list of available icons to use here as a button.

listItems.headline: Color variants
listItems.text: Choose a color that matches the semantic meaning of the action. Read more about semantic colors in Color Variants.

listItems.headline: Label
listItems.text: It is very important to label the icon button for screen-reader users.

content.title: Color Variants
content.leading: Color of the button signifies semantic meaning. Primary is the default.

data: This is the primary or main action that the interface is asking the user to take. Do not use more than one primary button in one view.
Supporting or alternative actions user can take within one view.
The brand color for uses that call for a more prominent color than the primary color.
Actions that are not critical to task completion, but may be helpful to the user. For example, a help button or a button to learn more about a feature.
Actions that can lead to unrecoverable consequences, for example deleting data permanently, clearing a form or leaving a meeting.

Actions that you might want the user to stop and think about first, because it might have consequences. For example, changing a project settings that will affect all users or removing a page that can affect systems that rely on that data.
Confirmation actions, like saving data, sending messages or acknowledging information.
